Package ru.nsu.martynov

Class Adjacency

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.nsu.martynov.Adjacency
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph
    public class Adjacency
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    The Adjacency class represents a graph using an adjacency matrix. It provides methods for adding/removing vertices and edges, retrieving neighbors, printing the graph, and reading the graph from a file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Adjacency()
      Constructs an empty adjacency matrix.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addEdge​(int from, int to)
      Adds an edge between two vertices in the graph.
      void addVert()
      Adds a new vertex to the graph.
      int[] getNeighbours​(int index)
      Returns an array of neighbors for a given vertex.
      int getVertCount()
      Returns the number of vertices in the graph.
      int[][] matrix()
      Returns the adjacency matrix.
      void printGraph()
      Prints the graph (adjacency matrix) to the console.
      void readFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Reads a graph from a file and fills the adjacency matrix.
      int remEdge​(int from, int to)
      Removes an edge between two vertices.
      void remVert​(int index)
      Removes a vertex by its index and adjusts the adjacency matrix accordingly.
